frame.name: Sharing
frame.definition:
<def-root>In this frame <fen>Protagonist_1</fen> and <fen>Protagonist_2</fen>, collectively <fen>Protagonists</fen>, allow one another to partake jointly the use of an <fen>Entity</fen> .
<ex><fex name="Pros">More than half of the group</fex> <t>shared</t> <fex name="Ent">needles</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Pro1">I</fex> <t>shared</t> <fex name="Ent">the cake</fex> <fex name="Pro2">with the ladies at the DAR meeting</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Protagonists
FE.definition:
<def-root>The jointly expressed participants in the use of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>It was a small house so <fex name="Pros">they</fex> had to <t>share</t> the bed.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Protagonist_1
FE.definition:
<def-root>The participant that is encoded as the subject of an active-form sentence or as a by-PP in a passive, who partakes in the joint usage of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Pro1">I</fex> <t>shared</t> my breakfast with the woman on my right, because she had forgotten hers.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Protagonist_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>The participant in the reciprocal event that is coded in a with-PP, who partakes in the usage of the <fen>Entity</fen> along with <fen>Protagonist_1</fen>.
<ex>When I looked back, Henry was <t>sharing</t> his juice <fex name="Pro2">with his classmate</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The object that is shared by the <fen>Protagonists</fen>.
<ex>Prices are based on two people <t>sharing</t> <fex name="Entity">a twin room</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location where the <fen>Protagonists</fen> partake jointly in the use of the <fen>Entity</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: share.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to use something jointly with another sentient being
